author: Cara Lombardo
title: Carl Icahn to Sell Federal-Mogul to Automotive Supplier Tenneco
text:
Carl Icahnâ€™s company is selling a car-parts maker it has controlled since 2008 for about $5.4 billion, including debt, hiving off a piece of an auto empire that includes holdings in rental services, ride hailing and repair shops.
Icahn Enterprises LP plans to sell Federal-Mogul to Tenneco Inc., which manufactures a wide range of automotive products such as Monroe shocks and Walker mufflers. In the deal Icahn Enterprises will receive $800 million in cash and 29.5 million shares in Tenneco.
